title: Solution to "stata_path option in configuration file is missing or invalid"
body:
Not sure if this belongs here, as this is my first GitHub post.

Anyways, I was having a problem running the "python -m stata_kernel.install" portion of the installation and my solution was not really covered in the FAQ.  Maybe it is, but it wasn't clear.

These are the EXTRA steps you need to take (i.e., you NEED to do the make shortcut, /register, etc.; but if you do that and get "stata_path option..." then try this):

1) Navigate to your personal folder: typically C:\Users\USERNAME (username is your username, so if your name is "statamcstataface" the directory would be C:\Users\statamcstataface)

2. Download the attached file (.stata_kernel.conf.txt) to your personal folder. 
[.stata_kernel.conf.txt](https://github.com/kylebarron/stata_kernel/files/4593625/default.stata_kernel.conf.txt)

3. Open the file.  On line two, rename the stata_path section - where it says [Insert the correct directory here] to the correct address of your STATA installation folder (make sure to delete the [ and ] as well).  I'm running StataMP-64, change that the StataSE if that's what your system is using.

4. Save as, and remove the ".txt" ending.  

The final name of the file should be .stata_kernel.conf and line two of said file should be your Stata installation folder. Then run "python -m stata_kernel.install" again. Hope it works for you, took me hours to figure out the problem.

If you don't want to download random files, here's the contents. Just make a new .txt file in your personal folder and paste it in:

[stata_kernel]
stata_path = "C:\Program Files\[Insert the correct directory here]\StataMP-64.exe"
execution_mode = automation
cache_directory = ~/.stata_kernel_cache
autocomplete_closing_symbol = False
graph_format = svg
graph_scale = 1
user_graph_keywords = coefplot,vioplot
